subject: [OT] HTML Parsing - was [junit] XML tree assertion
msgSnippet: JTidy can handle only a limited set of bad html .  I recently had a small gig that included parsing two commercial (but free) pages for certain content. --
messageBody:
JTidy can handle only a limited set of "bad html". I recently had a small
gig that included parsing two commercial (but free) pages for certain
content.

-- JTidy failed to parse either of them.
-- Tidy failed to parse either of them.
-- javax.swing.text.html doesn't handle all valid HTML tags (like Applet
<param> tags!)

I ended up using a combination of javax.swing.text.html.parser and
java.util.regex. Not recommended for a scalable, highly reliable service.

I recently came across a recommendation for "HTMLParser" from source
forge. It looks promising, but I have not tested it. My next "spare time"
project is to retrofit the parsing I mentioned above to use HTMLParser.

HTH

Ken


At 08:26 AM 2/25/2003 -0500, you wrote:
>My guess: JTidy. HTMLUnit uses it.
>
>So said Eric Armstrong on 2003-02-24 --------------------
>
> >"Vladimir R. Bossicard" wrote:
> >
> >> > Have you checked XMLUnit: http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/?
> >
> >Whoa! Did you see this:
> > "Even treat badly formed HTML as XML so it can be tested too."
> >
> >How on earth did they do that, and can that parser be extracted?!!
> >
> >
> >
